revised_title: Martensitic Transformation and Specific Heat Anomalies in Sodium
tldr: The author investigates the specific heat of sodium from 20 to 300 K, focusing on the martensitic transformation. They find that the specific heat in the two-phase region depends on the thermal history and proportions of the two phases present. The heat of transformation from hexagonal close-packed to body-centered cubic sodium is deduced to be about 10 cal/g atom. The Debye temperatures of the two phases are determined to be 160 and 153 K, respectively.
